result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hope T Marks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hope T Marks in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for Hope T Marks.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held OFF THE RECORD due to not having a court reporter. Parties are pursuing a DPA, TAD evaluation has been completed. Case is adjourned in Branch 15.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Hope T Marks in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Status Conference held.  State compliant with victim notification.  Victim present in court.  Defense requests adjourned status date to allow Defendant to have TAD evaluation completed.  
  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hope T Marks in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss material with the defendant. 
Parties advised"   Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RH, AB.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06/07/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Hope T Marks in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@1p
